bibl.title: Taichi Hiura v. Henry M. White. Order Discharging Petitioner
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the United States District Court for the Western District of Washington
In the Matter of the Petition of Hiura, Teiichi for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
Filed in the United States District Court
In the Matter of the Petition of Hiura, Teiichi for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.

In this cause an order to show cause why a writ of Habeas Corpus should not issue herein having been made an entered by the court, and the United States Immigration Commissioner at the Port of Seattle having made his return to said order to show cause, and the court having on this day made and entered an order herein granting a writ of Habeas Corpus returnable forthwith;

NOW, THEREFORE, the matter coming on for hearing, the petitioner being present in court and being represented by his attorney, James Kiefer, and the United States Immigration Commissioner at the Port of Seattle being represented by the United States Attorney;

It is by the court ORDERED, CONSIDERED and ADJUDGED, and the court does hereby ORDER, CONSIDER and ADJUDGE, that the confinement and restraint of the petitioner, Hiura,Teiichi, by the United States Immigration Commissioner at the Port of Seattle, is unlawful, and that the said petitioner is entitled to be admitted into the United States, and that said petitioner, Hiura, Teiichi, be, and he is hereby discharged and freed from any further detention or restraint by the said United States Commissioner of Immigration at the Port of Seattle.
Done in Open Court this 4th day of September,1920.
